intro: Haplopappus interior, commonly known as the interior roughhairs, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typically herbaceous growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Haplopappus interior is adapted to withstand drought and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
